FFDENetwork

Class FFDEChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • FFDENetwork.FFDEChannel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FFDEObserver

    @ThreadSafe
public class FFDEChannel
extends java.lang.Object
implements FFDEObserver
    Created by JM on 25.03.2016. This object represents a communication channel being a wrapper for a network socket (from java.net package) This allows to perform simplified interaction with the socket without much coding in other modules of FFDE package.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FFDEChannel

        public FFDEChannel(java.lang.String aName,
                   java.net.Socket aSocket,
                   FFDEEventDispatcher aDispatcher,
                   FFDETimer aTimer,
                   java.lang.String aEventID)
        Creates a new instance of FFDECHannel. Used to encapsulate Java.net.socket object.
        Parameters:
        aName - identifier of the channel
        aSocket - reference to the socket encapsulated by this channel
        aDispatcher - reference to the dispatcher collecting events from this channel
        aTimer - reference to the timer responsible for updating the channel
        aEventID - string used as an identifier for rx events coming from this channel

      • FFDEChannel

        public FFDEChannel(java.net.Socket aSocket,
                   FFDEEventDispatcher aDispatcher,
                   FFDETimer aTimer,
                   java.lang.String aEventID)
        Creates a new instance of FFDECHannel. Used to encapsulate Java.net.socket object.
        Parameters:
        aSocket - reference to the socket encapsulated by this channel
        aDispatcher - reference to the dispatcher collecting events from this channel
        aTimer - reference to the timer responsible for updating the channel
        aEventID - string used as an identifier for rx events coming from this channel

    • Method Detail

      • notifyFFDE

        public void notifyFFDE(FFDEEvent aEvent)
        TODO Overrides method from FFDENetwork.FFDEObserver interface. This method is called on timer tick.
        Specified by:
        notifyFFDE in interface FFDEObserver
        Parameters:
        aEvent - tick event, carries no data so it is unimportant

      • transmitMessage

        public void transmitMessage(java.util.List<java.lang.String> aData)
        Puts data in the transmission buffer of the channel. Then data is transmitted automatically. (This method assumes that a full message is loaded so it automatically adds '#' at the end)
        Parameters:
        aData - data to be transmitted

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns name of the channel.
        Returns:
        String identifier/name.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String aName)
        Sets name of the channel.
        Parameters:
        aName - new name

      • getRxBuffer

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRxBuffer()
        TODO

        DON'T USE THIS METHOD UNLESS YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING.

        This method returns first message from rx buffer of the channel. This should be done only in a few situations when event distribution system is disabled and notifyFFDE can not be called by a timer.
        Returns:
        data from rx buffer
